document_type: ISO 27001 Security Requirements - Annex A Control
applies_to_note: All gambling operators subject to RTS Chapter 4 - Security Requirements

control.control_title: Managing Information Security in the ICT Supply Chain
control.control_purpose: To manage information security risks associated with ICT products and services supply chain
control.control_objective: Establish processes and procedures to manage security risks throughout ICT product and service acquisitions and supply chain

iso_27001_definition.official_text: Processes and procedures should be defined and implemented to manage the information security risks associated with the ICT products and services supply chain.
key_requirements: Processes defined for ICT supply chain security
Procedures defined for ICT supply chain security
Information security risks of ICT supply chain identified and assessed
Supplier propagation of security requirements through their supply chain
Monitoring and validation of security requirements

ict_supply_chain_overview.definition: ICT (Information and Communications Technology) supply chain includes all products, services, and components that enable modern computing infrastructure
ict_supply_chain_overview.risk_context: Supply chain represents expanded risk surface - vulnerabilities can enter through components, subcontractors, and development pipeline
ict_supply_chain_overview.key_principle: Cannot assume products are secure - must verify and validate throughout acquisition and deployment
ict_supply_chain_overview.buildup_approach: Build on existing best practices for information security, project management, quality management and engineering

implementation_requirements.requirement: Define Information Security Requirements for Product/Service Acquisition
implementation_requirements.description: Establish information security requirements that must be met by ICT products and services being acquired

details.documentation: Security requirements documented and communicated to suppliers
details.baseline: Start with industry standards and organizational needs

implementation_requirements.requirement: Require Suppliers to Propagate Security Requirements
implementation_requirements.description: Suppliers must flow down security requirements to their suppliers and subcontractors

details.requirement: Suppliers contractually obligated to require their suppliers meet same security standards
details.chain: Security requirements propagated through entire supply chain
details.documentation: Supplier confirms security requirements passed to subcontractors
details.verification: Request evidence that subcontractors meet requirements
details.responsibility: Supplier responsible for security of their entire supply chain

implementation_requirements.description: Identify and understand all software components used in products and services

details.documentation: Product suppliers provide Software Bill of Materials (SBOM)
details.purpose: Identify potential supply chain security risks

implementation_requirements.description: Understand security features available in products and how to configure for security

details.configuration: Understand how to configure product securely
details.hardening: Know hardening guides and secure deployment procedures
details.defaults: Understand default security posture and necessary changes

implementation_requirements.requirement: Implement Monitoring and Validation of Security Requirements
implementation_requirements.description: Monitor and validate that suppliers meet agreed security requirements

details.validation: Verify requirements being met in practice
details.frequency: Based on risk and product criticality
details.documentation: Maintain records of monitoring and validation activities

implementation_requirements.requirement: Identify and Document Critical Products and Services
implementation_requirements.description: Identify ICT products and services critical to operations and document their importance

details.focus: Apply enhanced security requirements to critical products

implementation_requirements.requirement: Ensure Supply Chain Traceability for Critical Components
implementation_requirements.description: Trace origin and path of critical products and components through supply chain

details.purpose: Enable rapid response if supply chain compromise detected
details.documentation: Maintain traceability records for critical components
details.risk: Prevents undetected insertion of compromised components

implementation_requirements.requirement: Obtain Assurance Products Function as Expected
implementation_requirements.description: Verify and validate that ICT products function as expected and intended

assurance_activities: Functional testing to verify claimed features
details.purpose: Ensure product meets functional and security requirements
details.testing: Conduct testing during acquisition and periodically after deployment

implementation_requirements.requirement: Obtain Assurance Products Meet Security Levels
implementation_requirements.description: Verify and validate that products meet required security standards and levels

implementation_requirements.requirement: Establish Rules for Sharing Information about Issues
implementation_requirements.description: Define rules for sharing information about security issues, compromises, and vulnerabilities

details.escalation: Define when and to whom issues escalated

implementation_requirements.description: Establish processes for managing ICT product and component lifecycles and associated risks

details.planning: Plan for component end-of-life and replacement

implementation_requirements.requirement: Address Component Availability and Security Risks
implementation_requirements.description: Address risks associated with component and product availability throughout lifecycle

implementation_requirements.requirement: Consider Alternate Suppliers and Transfer Procedures
implementation_requirements.description: Identify alternative suppliers and plan for transferring to alternatives if needed

alternate_suppliers: Identify backup suppliers for critical products
transfer_planning: Document lessons learned from current supplier
details.timing: Plan transfers before vendor failure, not after

implementation_requirements.description: Acquire ICT products and services from reputable and established suppliers

details.due_diligence: Conduct background research on suppliers before engagement
details.risk: Purchasing from unknown or questionable sources introduces supply chain risk

ict_acquisition_process.description: Process for acquiring ICT products and services with security considerations

stages.name: Requirements Definition
stages.description: Define functional and security requirements for product/service

stages.name: Supplier Evaluation
stages.description: Evaluate suppliers against security and business criteria

stages.name: Product Evaluation
stages.description: Evaluate product meets requirements before deployment

stages.name: Lifecycle Management
stages.description: Manage product through lifecycle to end-of-life

steps.detail: Document organization's approach to managing ICT supply chain security
Establish baseline security requirements for ICT products/services by category

steps.action: Identify Critical ICT Products and Services
steps.detail: Assess and classify ICT products by criticality
Define process including security evaluation and requirements
Document all ICT products, versions, suppliers, and components
Evaluate existing suppliers and products against requirements
Implement ongoing assessment of supplier and product security

steps.action: Create SBOM (Software Bill of Materials) Process
steps.detail: Establish process for obtaining and managing component information
Establish process for tracking and remediating component vulnerabilities
Identify lifecycle risks and alternate suppliers for critical products

compliance_checklist.description: Steps to comply with ISO 27001 Annex A 5.21

checklist.item: Define security requirements for product acquisition
Identify critical ICT products and services
Inventory current ICT products and suppliers
Establish supplier agreements with security requirements
Conduct security assessments of critical products

common_mistakes.description: Top 3 mistakes organizations make with ICT supply chain management

mistakes.mistake: No contracts or requirements with ICT suppliers
mistakes.description: Operating with ICT suppliers without defining security requirements
root_cause: Assumption products are secure out of box
mistakes.impact: Insecure products deployed, no recourse if issues found
mistakes.prevention: Require security requirements in all ICT product acquisition
mistakes.action: Define and communicate security requirements to all suppliers

mistakes.mistake: No knowledge of what's in products (components)
mistakes.description: Unknown software components and dependencies in products
root_cause: Focus on product level, not component level
mistakes.impact: Unknown vulnerabilities, inability to respond to component exploits
mistakes.prevention: Request SBOM from all critical product suppliers
mistakes.example: Vulnerable open source component in critical application undetected

mistakes.mistake: Document and version control is wrong
mistakes.description: Poor documentation of ICT products and supply chain

audit_requirements.description: What auditors will check during ISO 27001 A 5.21 audit

audit_areas.description: Verify security requirements included in acquisition process
checks: Process documented for ICT product acquisition
Security evaluation conducted for critical products
SBOM obtained from critical product suppliers

audit_areas.description: Verify understanding of product security features
Verify ongoing monitoring of product security
Verify lifecycle management of ICT products

ukgc_application.critical_systems_context: ICT supply chain management critical for ensuring all software, hardware, and services supporting gambling systems meet security requirements

ict_supply_chain_requirements: Request SBOM and component documentation from RNG suppliers
Verify all components have known security status
Conduct security assessment of RNG software
Plan for component end-of-life and updates
Assess security of data handling components
Understand cloud platform components and architecture
Verify security functions of cloud platform
Plan for cloud provider changes or alternatives
Request SBOM for network devices and software
Understand network device firmware supply chain
Monitor for vulnerabilities in network components
Plan for firmware updates and patches

ukgc_application.compliance_requirement: Operators must manage ICT supply chain risks through defined acquisition processes, component tracking, security assessments, and ongoing monitoring for all critical ICT products and services

compliance_notes.overall_purpose: Identify and manage security risks in ICT supply chain through acquisition processes, component knowledge, security validation, and lifecycle management
compliance_notes.enforcement_priority: High - supply chain vulnerabilities can impact all critical systems
key_principles: Define security requirements before product acquisition
Require suppliers to flow down security requirements
Understand product security features and configuration
Conduct security assessments of critical products
Identify critical products and manage lifecycle
Trace components and products through supply chain
Plan for product end-of-life and alternatives

to_pass_the_audit.description: To comply with ISO 27001 Annex A 5.21 Managing Information Security in the ICT Supply Chain, implement

requirements.detail: Documented policy on managing ICT supply chain security
Security requirements included in all product/service acquisitions
Assess and classify ICT products by criticality
Maintain inventory of products, versions, and components
Obtain Software Bill of Materials for critical products
Include security requirements in supplier contracts
Conduct security assessments of critical products
Implement ongoing monitoring of supplier/product security
Track and remediate vulnerabilities in products/components
Plan for end-of-life and identify alternate suppliers

ISO 27001 A 5.19 - Information security in supplier relationships

acquisition_best_practices: Include security evaluation in RFP process
component_management_best_practices: Maintain SBOM for all critical products

regulatory_expectations: UKGC expects rigorous ICT supply chain management
Component-level awareness expected for critical systems
Regular security assessment of ICT products
Documented procedures for acquisition and lifecycle
Compliance approach should detail ICT supply chain management for critical systems
